title: Most effective champions in low elo
body: I recently started playing ranked and after losing all 10 placement matches playing jungle Vi i was placed in B5, I'm currently in B3 and i want to expand my champion selection. Currently from B5 to B3 i have been only playing Jinx mostly with some others rarely when i don't get her ( e.g. Leona, annie, vayne, Orianna, Lissandra). I'm looking for advice on the most effective champions currently for climb. I need champions that are safe to play, I'm willing to learn mechanically hard champions or  play ones that are mind numbingly simple. My favourite positions are Adc and mid, i am absolutely mediocre at jungle.

replies.body: You'd want to play champs that aren't seen in low elo (like Urgot, Yorick, Quinn etc.) as people wont know how to deal with them, plus they don't get banned. Based on your preferred positions Quinn might be one to look into.

Quinn is pretty strong in low elo, with many bronze players looking to play AA based hyper carries (vayne, driven, jinx) a good quinn can usually come out on top due to her blind and her bounce. Her passive is also kind of like Ashe's passive on steroids because it doesn't take as long to charge up but still does tonnes of damage. 

OMG Quinn though ♥
I love quinn! i play her a lot in normals but haven't had the chance in ranked. the first time i tried my teammates forced me to play vayne.
Just ignore what your team mates say and play her. Chances are they just think Quinn is trash tier.
She is trash tier in high elo where people actually understand how the game works, in low elo where people are %%%%%%ed the only thing that is trash tier is the players, not the champions.
how do you lose 10 games in a row rofl. how is that even possible.

Thanks for the list, i see you put vi and jarvan in the jungle recommended. But after losing my 10 placements with vi i've sort of have PTSD. I think it was mainly because i got blamed for every death on the team, ill try her again in b3 and see if its different now.
A good idea in ranked to to /ignore all when you get into the game and communicate solely by pings. It generally helps prevent the tilt from flaming and being flamed at

It isn't a bad idea but I like to tell people I'm doing it. Because some don't use pings at all unless they know it's the only way to get to you. Of course then you will get reported if you do badly without a doubt. So it's kinda risk reward.
PLAY TRYNDAMERE! he is really just another way of getting easy elo

Tryndamere is the worst top lanner in the game. Although Heimedinger gives him a run for his money. The thing is the slightest bit of cc destroys trynd. If he runs into a teamfight and can't get his ulti off he's pretty much free money.

-> Pick Annie
-> Low elo players never play safe vs anything
-> Enjoy free kills each time Ult comes of CD
-> Annie literally cannot lose lane and her Ult solo wins teamfights
-> If you're any good then you'll probably win like 90% of games until you reach high Gold

{{champion:11}} is really effective in low ELO.

His CC denying ulti, easy kit and tons of Phreak.

Farm up, help team, win game.

Play {{champion:34}} , she's free wins against low elo, people wont track your passive and underestimate your burst every single game unless they also play Freezy Bird (which is really unlikely).
You also need to learn all roles, your aim in this game is understanding how every aspect of the game works so you can react in the appropriate way, it's just like a fighting game; you're not going to win if your against a matchup you're not familiar with in most cases.

AOE CC - Leona, Malphite, Amumu

Splitpushers - Nasus, Jax, AD Nidalee

1v5'ers - Katarina, Riven, Akali, Fiora
